author: Omar Lehman
comment: I love it! Well I'm loving it less. My day starts at about 2am but I can't get current info before 9am. And I found out that although my current temp comes from 2 miles west of me everything else comes from a station 11 miles north of here. Here in Colorado the weather that far north can be drastically different.

author: Gil Kloepfer
comment: Very useful interface to the NWS weather information with well-designed and intuitive presentation.  Edit 2/28/2018: Still using this app and have been really pleased with the support the developer provides.  Great job!

author: Bryan W
comment: As someone who assists a family member with snow removal in the off season and construction during the rest of the year, this has proven incredibly useful. Love how I can add and monitor a virtually limitless list of cities. The devs have done an incredible job in compiling all the weather data from NOAA's site into a very easy to use platform. I utilize underground, weather channel and this app the most. The other 2 apps give an idea of what could come and once within 24-48 hrs of projected weather, this app (technically NOAA data) confirms what is to come.

author: Jordan Cassel
comment: For sure the best weather app in the play store!!

author: Travis Hett
comment: Easy to Read, super useful weather app.

author: James Siros
comment: Love the app and the access to forecast discussions. It would be nice to access weather for other locations without adding them to my favorites.

author: Chris Danfelt
comment: It's one of my favorite apps. Love the chart feature for forecasting. Accuracy is good for locations I frequently use.

author: Helen Jackson
comment: I trust NOAA weather above all others. More accurate than the others in my little town in AZ.

author: Todd Kuhl
comment: great weather app. i don't know what else it could do, aside from control the weather.

author: Thomas Perkins
comment: It's ok but no alarms

author: Joe Lucarelli
comment: Because it's so simple and accurate

author: Mike Q
comment: I like it

author: Nikita Filin
comment: Great functionality, just needs a UI update.

author: Edmund Davis-Quinn
comment: Excellent app, extremely useful. Great information.

author: Joyce Gifford
comment: Best app for weather.

author: George Saxon
comment: Great says it all.
Love it !

author: D.H Wendt
comment: I find the Radar and hourly forecast most helpful.  Often NWS will forecast continuing rain or snow while Radar clearly shows the weather system has moved out of the area. I find that cross-checking the two gives a more accurate picture.

author: Steve Franklin
comment: I love this app (paid version) and have been using it for years. It is easy to set up so the information I want appears upon opening. And should I desire any more detail, it is easy to access as well. I especially like being able to pre-program cities along my cross country driving routes so I know what I'm driving into in the next day or two.

author: George Wolf
comment: This app gives me more information about the weather in one place than any other app I have seen. I use it 4 or 5 times a day. Edit 2/16/18; The app has gradually improved. I am especially aware of the radar map display, which keeps becoming clearer. Although it uses National Weather Service data, the map display is actually better than the one on the NWS website. The most useful part for me is the hourly forecast graph. It plots chance of precipitation, temperature, wind etc. for several days in advance, showing fairly precisely when conditions will change. Again it's better than that on the NWS website. Another feature allows me to select between point forecasts in various parts of the US. That way, I can keep track of the weather near my elderly parents as easily as my own. Whenever I get a new device, this is one of the first apps I download.

I use the paid version of this app.  When it works, it's great; however, too frequently it can't (or won't) update the forecast and current conditions. Hours-old weather information isn't very useful when I need to know what the temperature is now, not what it used to be. Don't expect this to be your only weather app if you want current information at all times.

author: Rob Griffin
comment: Im glad everyone else is having no problems. I however am sitting in a city that is 11 degrees cooler than this app has stated. This happens all the time. I lost my money on this deal. The app is consistently giving false information.

reply.author: Granite Apps
reply.content: The temperatures come from actual weather stations operated by NOAA. They probably aren't wrong unless NOAA is having some outage, but its possible they don't represent your geographic area. The app allows you to see where the stations are located and you can choose a different station if it better fits your area.

author: William Taylor
comment: I depend on this app for the weather on a daily and/or weekly temps and rain. This does the trick for me.

author: mike mcdonnell
comment: Easy. Convenient.  I travel a lot.  All my destinations are stored for easy access to their forecasts plus the forecast for wherever I happen to be.  I use this every day.
Gives me the info I want quickly and clearly. Great, flexible app!

author: Sandrus Daniel
comment: Great been very good.The best that I have found is very accurate, it's super, been using it now for 2 yrs it does a super job

author: Steve King
comment: Absolutely the best weather app for the National Weather Service coverage area.

author: Debbie Knight
comment: not quite as accurate as I thought but pretty good.

author: Anonymous User
comment: Forced update to add advertising.

author: Jason Siebeneck
comment: I like The hourly detail.   Find this app is very good for work.

author: Kenny Searles
comment: Awesome app. Exactly what I need

author: Jacob Harvey
comment: Accurate and in depth.

author: David Meleski
comment: Pretty good. Love the radar movements.

author: Roxana Witter
comment: Great detail.  Love the daily graph.
Best weather app available

author: Dennis Heathcock
comment: Very good app

author: millhunky222
comment: Radar is my favorite

author: Leslie-Ann Francis
comment: Great resource.

author: Trevor Rowland
comment: Easy to use.

author: James Hudson
comment: Love it!!
